property.name: text
property.value: Each time the model is run, create a new log.

property.name: text
property.value: Read from the log. In the GDP, record numbers start at 1.

property.name: text
property.value: Append to the end of the log. Each time the model is run, a new log is created, so the append starts with record number 1.

property.name: text
property.value: If logdname is blank, then the local hostname is used. To use the production servers, try: edu.berkeley.eecs.gdp-01.gdplogd

property.name: text
property.value: Create a new log, append, read and subscribe to it.

property.name: text
property.value: Subscribe to the log.

property.name: text
property.value: Unfortunately, running this model requires that a number of libraries be installed. To install these packages, invoke $PTII/org/terraswarm/accessor/accessors/web/gdp/adm/gdp-setup.sh

property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={894, 336, 499, 208}, maximized=false}

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Read a log from the Global Data Plane (GDP).

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee, Nitesh Mor. Contributor: Christopher Brooks

property.name: debugLevel (parameter)
property.value: The value of the GDP debug flag. See gdp/README-developers.md for a complete summary. The value is typically "pattern=level", for example "gdplogd.physlog=39". To see the patterns, use the "what" command or strings $PTII/lib/libgdp* | grep '@(#)'. Use "*=40" to set the debug level to 40 for all components. The value of level is not usually over 127. Values over 100 may modify the behavior.

property.name: trigger (port)
property.value: An input that triggers firing the reading of the data.

property.name: recno (port)
property.value: The record number to be read. In the GDP, the first record is record 1.

property.name: data (port)
property.value: The data that is read from the log

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value

entity.name: Ramp2
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value

entity.name: RandomInteger2
entity.doc: Create a sequence of integers that are uniformly sampled from the range 32-bit integers

property.name: expression
property.value: "ptolemy.actor.lib.jjs.modules.gdp.test.auto.GDPLogAppendRead." + random() + "." + input

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Create a Global Data Plane (GDP) log.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks

property.name: version
property.value: $$Id: GDPLogCreate.js 1597 2017-04-29 15:41:50Z cxh $$

property.name: debugLevel (parameter)
property.value: The value of the GDP debug flag. See gdp/README.md for a complete summary. The value is typically "pattern=level", for example "gdplogd.physlog=39". To see the patterns, use the "what" command or strings $PTII/lib/libgdp* | grep '@(#)'. Use "*=40" to set the debug level to 40 for all components. The value of level is not usually over 127. Values over 100 may modify the behavior.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: An output that is written to when the creation is complete.

property.name: trigger (port)
property.value: An input that triggers firing the reading of the data

property.name: logname (port)
property.value: The GDP logname. By convention, use a reverse fully qualified name like "org.ptolemy.actor.lib.jjs.modules.gdp.demo.GDPLogRead.GDPLogRead"

property.name: logdname (port)
property.value: The IP address or DNS name of the gdp router. If empty, then the swarm.gdp.routers key is searched for in the gdp configuration file ep_adm_para, in the following order "`.ep_adm_params:~/.ep_adm_params:/usr/local/etc/ep_adm_params:/etc/ep_adm_params`" The values of swarm.gdp.routers are then contacted in order.

property.value: {bounds={935, 628, 499, 208}, maximized=false}

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
Subscribe to a Global Data Plane (GDP) log.

FIXME: What is the meaning of the startrec and numrec arguments? Makes no sense for subscription.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks, Edward A. Lee, Nitesh Mor

property.name: version
property.value: $$Id: GDPLogSubscribe.js 2098 2017-09-07 00:25:10Z eal $$

property.name: logname (port)
property.value: The GDP logname. By convention, a log name should be a reverse fully qualified name like "org.terraswarm.accessor.demo.MyDemoName". If this input is an empty string, then no subscription will occur until a non-empty value is provided. By default, this is empty. Providing an empty string will unsubscribe from any previously subscribed-to log. See the [GDP Infrastructure wiki[(https://gdp.cs.berkeley.edu/redmine/projects/gdp-sensor-and-actuator-deployments/wiki/Berkeley_Sensor_Deployments) for a list of GDP logs.

property.name: logdname (port)
property.value: The name of a logd server. If empty, then the hostname of the local machine is used. This server is a gateway into the GDP. FIXME: Shouldn't this be a parameter rather than input?

property.name: numrec (port)
property.value: The number of records to read.

property.name: startrec (port)
property.value: The record number to be read. In the GDP, the first record is record 1.

property.name: timeout (port)
property.value: The timeout in milliseconds.

property.name: data (port)
property.value: The data that is read from the log.

property.name: debugLevel (parameter)
property.value: The value of the GDP debug flag. See gdp/README-developers.md for a complete summary. The value is typically "pattern=level", for example "gdplogd.physlog=39". To see the patterns, use the "what" command or strings $PTII/lib/libgdp* | grep '@(#)'. Use "*=40" to set the debug level to 40 for all components. The value of level is not usually over 127. Values over 100 may modify the behavior.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Append string data to a Global Data Plane (GDP) log. If a log with the specified name does not exist, it is automatically created.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks, Edward A. Lee, Nitesh Mor

property.name: version
property.value: $$Id: GDPLogAppend.js 1597 2017-04-29 15:41:50Z cxh $$

property.name: data (port)
property.value: The data to be written.

property.name: debugLevel (parameter)
property.value: The value of the GDP debug flag. See gdp/README-developers.md for a complete summary. The value is typically "pattern=level", for example "gdplogd.physlog=39". To see the patterns, use the "what" command or strings $PTII/lib/libgdp* | grep '@(#)'. Use "*=40" to set the debug level to 40 for all components. The value of level is not usually over 127. Values over 100 may modify the behavior.
